skill.name: gcloud
skill.description: Google Cloud Platform CLI - manage GCP resources including Compute Engine, Cloud Run, GKE, Cloud Functions, Storage, BigQuery, and more.
skill.summary: Google Cloud Platform CLI - manage GCP resources including Compute Engine, Cloud Run, GKE, Cloud Fun...
skill.author: Dicklesworthstone

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown documentation with example gcloud CLI commands. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access code is present. The skill poses no security risk to users.

content.value_statement: Managing Google Cloud Platform resources requires remembering many gcloud CLI commands and flags. This skill provides comprehensive documentation and examples for all major GCP services. Use it to quickly find and execute commands for compute instances, Cloud Run, GKE, storage buckets, BigQuery, and more.
actual_capabilities: Authenticate with Google Cloud using user accounts or service accounts
List, create, update, and delete Compute Engine virtual machines
Deploy and manage Cloud Run services and Cloud Functions
Create and manage GKE clusters with kubectl integration
Work with Cloud Storage buckets and object operations
Query datasets and manage tables in BigQuery
limitations: Requires gcloud CLI to be installed on the system
User must have appropriate GCP permissions for operations
Does not provide interactive prompts for missing parameters
Commands must be run in a terminal with gcloud access

use_cases.title: Deploy cloud infrastructure
use_cases.description: Create and manage virtual machines, Kubernetes clusters, and serverless containers on GCP.

use_cases.title: Query BigQuery datasets
use_cases.description: Run SQL queries against BigQuery datasets and manage data loading from Cloud Storage.

use_cases.title: Configure cloud resources
use_cases.description: Set up IAM roles, service accounts, Secret Manager secrets, and networking components.

prompt_templates.title: List VM instances
prompt_templates.prompt: List all Compute Engine instances in my GCP project using gcloud CLI.

prompt_templates.title: Deploy Cloud Run
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy a container image to Cloud Run with public access enabled using gcloud CLI.

prompt_templates.title: Create GKE cluster
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new GKE cluster with 3 nodes in us-central1-a zone using gcloud CLI.

prompt_templates.title: Query BigQuery
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a query to select 10 rows from my dataset.table in BigQuery using gcloud CLI.

output_examples.input: List all Compute Engine instances in my GCP project using gcloud CLI
output: NAME: my-vm, ZONE: us-central1-a, STATUS: RUNNING
NAME: test-vm, ZONE: us-central1-b, STATUS: STOPPED
Use 'gcloud compute instances describe NAME --zone=ZONE' for details

best_practices: Always specify region and zone explicitly to avoid configuration confusion
Use --quiet flag for automated scripts to prevent confirmation prompts
Format output as JSON or table for easier parsing in scripts
anti_patterns: Running destructive commands without --quiet in automation
Using default project without verifying the correct project is set
Hardcoding credentials in scripts instead of using application default credentials

faq.question: Is gcloud CLI required to use this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, the gcloud CLI must be installed and configured on your system. Install from the official Google Cloud documentation.

faq.question: What GCP services are supported?
faq.answer: Compute Engine, Cloud Run, GKE, Cloud Functions, Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud SQL, Pub/Sub, Secret Manager, IAM, and more.

faq.question: How do I authenticate?
faq.answer: Use 'gcloud auth login' for user accounts or 'gcloud auth activate-service-account' with a key file for service accounts.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these commands?
faq.answer: Commands run locally using your credentials. No data is sent to third parties. Ensure proper IAM permissions are configured.

faq.question: Why did my command fail?
faq.answer: Common issues include: missing gcloud installation, incorrect project, insufficient permissions, or invalid resource names. Check each requirement.

faq.question: How is this different from Google Cloud Console?
faq.answer: The gcloud CLI provides scriptable, repeatable operations. It is ideal for automation, CI/CD pipelines, and reproducible infrastructure.
